Which data stream category should be assigned to use the data for time-based operations in segmentation and calculated insights?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
There are only three data stream category: Profile, Engagement, Other. and the Engagement has the Date as Primary Key FYI.

https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.c360_a_category.htm&type=5

Selected Answer: C
It's C. The "Transaction" data stream category is specifically designed for time-based operations, whereas D(Engagement) is for tracking customer's web activities like page views or clicking, etc.

The answer should be " Transaction" - C and not D.

Data streams are the sources of data that are ingested into Data Cloud and mapped to the data model. Data streams have different categories that determine how the data is processed and used in Data Cloud.
Transaction data streams are used for time-based operations in segmentation and calculated insights, such as filtering by date range, aggregating by time period, or calculating time-to-event metrics. Transaction data streams are typically used forevent data, such as purchases, clicks, or visits, that have a timestamp and a value associated with them.

What is the most efficient option to allow for this capability?

choices.C: Create a reusable container block with common criteria.
choices.D: Create a segment and copy it for each brand.
choices.A: Create, publish, and deploy a data kit.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The most efficient option to ensure that every segment managed by multiple brand teams adheres to the same set of exclusion criteria, which are updated on a monthly basis, is:
C. Create a reusable container block with common criteria.
This approach allows you to define the exclusion criteria once and then reuse this container block across multiple segments. When the criteria need to be updated, you only need to update the container block, and all segments using it will automatically reflect the changes.

Selected Answer: B
By stopping the publish schedule, the segment's activation is paused without deactivating or deleting the segment, allowing you to reuse it in the future. This approach preserves the segment's data and configurations for future use.

A reusable container block allows the consultant to define a set of exclusion criteria that can be used across multiple segments. This approach is efficient because:
The block can be updated centrally each month.
Changes to the container block automatically propagate to all segments that use it, ensuring consistency and saving time.

questions.question_text: What should a user do to pause a segment activation with the intent of using that segment again?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
If a segment is no longer needed, it can be deactivated through Data Cloud and applies to all chosen targets. A deactivated segment no longer publishes, can’t be chosen for an activation, and can’t be re-enabled. If you plan to use the segment again, stop the publish schedule instead.
